title: Since East Asia has a famous history of historical big organised crime like the Russian mafia, yakuza, and triad, does Korea have one? - Quora
tags: Yakuza (organized crime syndicates originating in Japan)

response.answer_text: South Korea doesn’t have it. Corresponding terminology is ‘Jopok’. It is shortened name of ‘Jojik Pokryeokbae’. It means ‘organized(jojik) + violence(pokryeok) + rogues(bae)’. Currently, size of Jopok organization is not over 50 in an clique, any region. (Usually, the size is under 10.) Related crime is ‘Beom-jeo danche jojik joe’. It means ‘Illegal(beom-joe) association(danche) organizing(jojik) crime(joe)’. About that crimes, all Korean mafia bosses piss.
